name: Osage Orange Trees row
desc: A historic hedge tree; look for bumpy orange fruits in fall.
hint: Walk toward the community garden near Theal House.

name: Brock Community Garden
desc: Student-run plots with pollinators and veggies.
hint: From here, head north to the evergreen by the lawn.

name: White Cedar
hint: Find the classic Canadian maple nearby.

name: Sugar Maple
desc: Brilliant fall color; maple syrup icon!
hint: Seek a hard, dark seed—Kentucky Coffee Tree.

name: Kentucky Coffee Tree
desc: Large pods; bold branching in winter.
hint: A white pine by a small labyrinth is next.

name: White Pine and Labrynth
hint: Two thousand rings? Look for the time edge.

name: 2000 years on edge
desc: A timeline edge marking ages of trees.
hint: Find the living fossil with fan leaves.

name: Ginkgo Biloba
hint: Head to the Indigenous Healing Garden.

name: Indigenous Healing Garder
desc: Native plants used in traditional healing.
hint: Next: bee friends at the pollinator garden.

name: Bee Pollinator Garden
hint: Take a breather at the rest point.

name: Rest Point
hint: Find the rows of spring blossoms.

name: Cherry Trees Rows
desc: Rows of cherries; blossom in spring.
hint: Locate the red-tinted oak: Pin Oak.

name: Pin Oak
desc: Tiered branches; deep sinuses; red fall color.
hint: Cherry blossoms and a Japanese corner ahead.

name: Cherry Blossoms and Japanese ...
desc: A quiet corner with ornamental cherries.
hint: Look for weeping willows near water.

name: Weeping Willows
desc: Graceful drooping branches near wet areas.
hint: A tough weed with a purple flower next.

name: Milk Thistle
hint: Find white maples and hawthorn nearby.

name: White Maples?? AND Hawthorne
desc: Mixed trees forming a small edge.
hint: Back to more Osage orange along the edge.
